docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: William Safire (column, May 16) calls for a broad public debate over issues like therapeutic cloning. It's not a bad idea, but that debate may have already been decided for us.

headline.main: Therapeutic Cloning Is Out of the Box

docs.abstract: Bruce Neuman letter comments on William Safire's May 16 column calling for broad public debate over issues like therapeutic cloning; drawing
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    William Safire (column, May 16) calls for a broad public debate over issues like therapeutic cloning. It's not a bad idea, but that debate may have already been decided for us.

docs.lead_paragraph: Like many people taking drugs to combat H.I.V., Steven Hodges, a former hairdresser here, noticed a few years ago that he was becoming gaunt and hollow-cheeked even though he still felt healthy. ''I didn't feel sick, and I didn't want to look sick,'' he said. ''But all my clients kept saying, 'Are you O.K.?' -- which doesn't make you feel any better.''

headline.main: H.I.V. Patients Try to Remedy Gaunt Appearance

docs.abstract: Article on treatments being offered to HIV and AIDS patients to ease lipodystrophy, disruption of body's methods of processing and distributing fat that results in loss of fat on face and accumulation of fatty tissue on shoulders and around neck and belly; corrective procedures, including liposuction and plastic surgery, are not cheap and insurance companies generally refuse to cover costs; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: The Legislature and the governor acted today to require health insurance plans to cover most infertility treatments, bringing an abrupt, surprising end to three years of wrangling. The mandate was inserted into one of the bills that make up the state budget after overnight negotiations involving the Senate, the Assembly and Gov. George E. Pataki. The Legislature passed the bills today, and the governor's office said he would sign them.

headline.main: State Will Require Coverage Of Treatment for Infertility

docs.abstract: New York State legislature and Gov Pataki act to require health insurance plans to cover most infertility treatments, bringing abrupt, surprising end to three years of wrangling (M)
